intro: Hieracium laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium laevigatum is often found in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
